title: The Tacoma Narrows Bridge: Beauty That Killed
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Tacoma Narrows Bridge: Beauty That Killed.

hook.text: In 1940, a bridge twisted itself apart in a 40 mph wind. The collapse was caught on film â€” and changed engineering.

buildup.text: The Tacoma Narrows Bridge was designed to be elegant and slender â€” thin road deck, graceful suspension cables.

discovery.text: Wind caused the deck to oscillate violently â€” a phenomenon called aeroelastic flutter that engineers hadn't modeled.

twist.text: Cheaper, wider bridge designs wouldn't have failed. Beauty and cost-cutting combined to create catastrophe.

climax.text: After Tacoma Narrows, every suspension bridge in the world was redesigned. One failure improved thousands.

punchline.text: The most famous bridge collapse taught us that looking good isn't enough.
